title: 114_hr2332
content: The Act titled "Nation Building Here at Home Act of 2015" establishes a Transformational Infrastructure Competitive Grant Program. The "Nation Building Here at Home Act of 2015" establishes a transformational infrastructure competitive grant program under which the Secretary of Transportation can make competitive grants to state governments, local governments, transit agencies, and port authorities for eligible projects. The "Nation Building Here at Home Act of 2015" establishes a grant program for eligible infrastructure projects, including highway and bridge projects under title 23, United States Code. The grant program established by the "Nation Building Here at Home Act of 2015" covers various infrastructure projects such as bridge replacements, seismic retrofit projects, public transportation projects, rail transportation projects, and port infrastructure investments. The "Nation Building Here at Home Act of 2015" grant program covers infrastructure projects including rail transportation, port infrastructure investments, aviation infrastructure, and water infrastructure. Coordination is required for water infrastructure projects with the EPA and Army. The grant program under the "Nation Building Here at Home Act of 2015" requires coordination with the EPA and Army for water infrastructure projects. Entities must submit applications meeting specified criteria to be eligible for grants. The Secretary will issue regulations for grant awards based on specified criteria, including financial commitments for proposed projects. The Secretary will issue regulations for grant awards based on financial commitments for proposed projects, ensuring equitable distribution geographically. The Federal share of project costs may not exceed 100 percent. The Secretary will ensure equitable distribution of grants geographically, address urban and rural needs, promote veteran training and employment, and allocate a percentage of grant amounts to small businesses owned by disadvantaged individuals. (g) Applicability of Title 40.--Projects funded by grants under this Act must comply with Title 40, United States Code. (h) Buy America requirements mandate that all iron, steel, and manufactured goods used in a project must be produced in the United States, with some exceptions. The Buy America requirements mandate that iron, steel, and manufactured goods used in a project funded by grants under this Act must be produced in the United States, with exceptions allowed if not produced in sufficient quantities or quality in the US. The Buy America requirements mandate that iron, steel, and manufactured goods used in a project funded by grants under this Act must be produced in the United States. Exceptions are allowed if not produced in sufficient quantities or quality in the US, but if the inclusion of these US-produced materials increases the project cost by more than 25 percent, a detailed justification for the waiver must be published in the Federal Register. This subsection must be applied in a manner consistent with US obligations under international agreements. International agreements must be considered when applying the subsection. The Secretary must ensure grants are used efficiently, provide grant information on a Department of Transportation website, and report to Congress within a year. The Secretary must coordinate with relevant agencies to streamline environmental reviews for projects funded by grants under this section. The Secretary must coordinate with agencies to streamline environmental reviews for projects funded by grants under this section. $985 billion is authorized for grants for eligible projects from 2016 to 2020. The Secretary will allocate 85% of the funds for projects in subsection (c)(1)(A), (B), or (C), 2% for projects in subsection (c)(1)(D), 4% for projects in subsection (c)(1)(E), and 9% for projects in subsection (c)(1)(F). The Nation Building Here at Home Financing Initiative is outlined in Section 3. The Secretary of the Treasury, in consultation with the Secretary of Transportation, will establish a Nation Building Here at Home Financing Initiative within 180 days of the Act's enactment. The Treasury Secretary is authorized to issue bonds for the initiative, with a maximum total face value of $300 billion, subject to specific terms and conditions. The Secretary of the Treasury may issue bonds with specified terms and conditions. The proceeds will be given to the Secretary of Transportation for the program under section 2(a) of the Act. The Secretary of Transportation must submit a report to Congress within 180 days of the Act's enactment, detailing the transportation needs of the US for the next 20, 30, and 50 years.
